Comment: standard opening yet again
he prefers to avoid the center-board opening and just frees up his bishop and sets up f7-f5
i protect the free-floating and free up my black bishop to prevent his uncontested move to h6
he goes to g7 instead, bringing the bishop into play and avoiding a piece trade - he has a good attacking position if i forget myself and move that c1 bishop out anytime soon
bringing out the knight
freeing the other bishop and protecting some more row 5 real estate
setting up the castling, nothing more, though that bishop may be useful later
and he sets up the castle as well, though his position on that side is potentially a little flawed
i castle
and he follows suit
now that the king's tucked away, time to set up a bit more aggressive pawn structure
he keeps staggering his pawns to prevent any further decisive advance
and i keep moving forward for the attack - so far he's maintaining a defensive position while i try to set up an advance
moving the bishop out, potentially to cut some holes in those forward ranks if he gets a chance
the knight goes out to protect some pawn positions and free up that rook to set up shop on an open rank eventually
defending against the knight coming in, which i wouldn't have gained much from anyway
offering the first piece trade

but he declines, sacrificing a knight in order to cut some holes in my pawn structure. he also gets a bonus that i missed at first, which is that his bishop at g7 attacks the rook, and if i moved it to b1, he'd have me forked with the queen and i'd lose the bishop anyway
sure enough, i take the knight
and he grabs my rook without a problem
